channel.title: Epic surprise
channel.description:
So last night (9/4/10) my dad and I decided to drive roughly an hour and a half to South Park, PA to goto a rib and wing fest. After eating wings and ribs for about 2 hours someone came up on stage to announce that the #1 Call of Duty player in the US was holding a competition there (basically you got $10 and an autographed jacket if you beat him). I got my ass handed to me, but it was fun and I got his gamertag and what not. So after about another 2 or 3 hours of sitting in front of the stage (live music ofc), one of the bands announced that "Fuel" would be the next/final band, and Fuel is fucking epic band. Well, it was true, and i was not even 30 ft from the stage :D
Video etc, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nCQp1HvEd2o
Greatest night I've had in a long time. Amazing ribs & wings, got to play COD against the #1 player in the us (Brandon Englert), and got to see one of my favorite bands. Oh and the admission price to the festival/cook-off was only $7 a person :D

item.title: Epic surprise
item.dc:creator: @beast_k0 beast k0
item.description:
@beast_k0 wrote:

im sure you had a JizzTastic Adventure!!!

item.title: Epic surprise
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Nice, $75 isn’t bad. It was funny though, because the fairground were fairly empty till about an hour before Fuel was scheduled to come on. But literally, when we left the crowd was solid people for about 100 yards back from the stage.

Read full topic

item.title: Epic surprise
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Ya it was The expensive food was expected ofc. But we basically could have gotten a full-length concert for $7 (compared to the $130 tickets for the Lady GaGa concert in Pittsburgh tonight).

item.title: Epic surprise
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Ya, the main admission was only $7 a person (8 and under were free) but the food and drinks were all expensive (I think we payed $22 for a bucket of wings). And it was $5 a play against the cod kid.

Read full topic
